title: Hat
text: The sombrero, or wide-brimmed straw hat, is recognized by its high, pinched crown. While dyed palm leaves are often woven into colorful stripes around a sombrero's crown, this particular example has been further decorated with numerous imported ribbons of silk and wool. These ribbons would shimmer and sway to the movement of the wearer. An attention-grabbing hat like this is an apt headpiece for a village leader who would have worn it to a community-wide celebration. In recent years, more and more men have adopted Western dress, replacing the straw sombrero with plain brown or black felt hats.
description: brimmed straw hat with conical top; clusters of red, green, and yellow ribbons hang over brim and from top; red and yellow silk tassel on top
